content.text:
# 1971 in the Democratic Republic of the Congo

The following lists events that happened during 1971 in the Democratic Republic of the Congo.
Incumbents
*President – Mobutu Sese Seko
Events
{|class=wikitable
!style="width:7em"|Date !! event
|-
|
| Democratic Republic of the Congo opens its embassy in Brasília, Brazil.
|-
| June
| Zairian Armed Forces (FAZ) conduct reprisals after rebels led by Laurent-Désiré Kabila are active in South Kivu.
|-
| 4 June
| Joseph Kabila, future president of the DRC, is born in Fizi Territory, South Kivu province.
|-
| 27 October
| The Democratic Republic of the Congo is renamed Zaire
|}
References
Sources
* }}
*
